data.title: Good Breakfast
data.text: I ordered Juevos Rancheros and it was lovely. I asked for the eggs to be poached, they were perfect. The beans were homemade, not canned.  The salsa is excellent.

data.title: It was ok
data.text: The place itself is not bad. It's well lit with plenty of seating and clean. The staff was very friendly. We went in for the 4.95 breakfast special. As you can see from the pictures the hash browns were a little too done. The food came out super fast but then realized the eggs were under cooked. Excellent biscuits and gravy. Good service and reasonable prices, about $15 for a lot of food. Will try it again to see if it can be better.

data.title: A Great Diner Experience
data.text: This is a great diner.  The food is fantastic and the prices are reasonable.  The employees are helpful and friendly.  I highly recommend the Peoria Cafe for breakfast and the Friday Fish Fry.

data.title: Nice Breakfast Special
data.text: This is a local favorite hangout. You can't beat the breakfast special - nice staff and decent food.As soon as you walk in you will realize that this is a place for the regulars which means good food. If you are looking for a diamond star restaurant - this is not it...but it is good reliable decently priced food. Breakfast is my favorite, but they make a tasty patty melt and fish in chips.

data.title: Sunday breakfast
data.text: This is the place for a hardy breakfast at a reasonable price. Huge portions that will stick with you for a whole day! The place was very busy, but I was seated right away and was in and out really fast. The servers are friendly and attentive. They serve all of the usual breakfast items, and quite a few Mexican specialties, like Menudo, chorizo, etc. My "cowboy" breakfast was good with the chicken-fried steak and perfect hash browns. They are pretty much a breakfast and lunch place, but open from 6a-8p on Fridays. Pretty good for your typical American cafe.

data.title: A little piece of friend fish fabulous on a Friday.
data.text: When you're looking for a fabulous Friday fish fry, the Peoria Cafe is the place to go. The prices are reasonable and they have both an all you can eat option and a standard dinner option. The fish is all battered and fried fresh on side and the taste is absolutely spectacular. It gets busy because all the locals know how great it is, so it's good to go early. Depending on what else is going on in the area, they might run out and you don't want to miss this delicious treat. They only do it on Friday, so bring your appetite and get ready for great service, great prices, and fabulous fish!

data.title: Best Fish Fry in the Country!!!!!
data.text:
Well, we are in Peoria again, and HAd TO GO TO PEORIA CAFE for the fish fry.  We are going back tonight.... They aren't open in the evenings......only on Friday for the Fry, and it is always packed.  It is kinda noisy, but sit outside if you can...... But the cod is fried to perfection, with slaw and a choice of mashed, baked or fried potatoes..... and a dinner roll..... it is the bomb!!! 
My husband and I have traveled from coast to coast and have eaten a lot of fish fries..... this is the BEST!!!! You can get a regular serving....which is 4-5 pieces, for 8.99 or all you can eat for 10.99.  I can't imagine eating more than the regular serving.  I love it, and hope they NEVER close!!!!!

data.title: We like this place
data.text: First place I found with decent Menudo. Though I have had their hardy breakfast...eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns (all good), I come here for the Menudo. The management staff is always friendly but it is a hit or a miss on your waitress. The place is always busy (at least for breakfast on a Sunday morning) so it is understandable if your waitress could be a little irritable. The pancakes are also good. I highly recommend Peoria Cafe.

data.title: Ma and Pa
data.text: This is an honest to goodness downtown diner like you remember if you're over 50 or so. Nothing special, except fish on friday, but just darn good food at a fair price. That's why they're still there.

data.title: Such a Great Place
data.text: We only waited about five minutes on a Sunday morning. The service was great! The prices were VERY reasonable. The portions were so BIG! The place was clean and everyone was super friendly.

data.title: Great little place......
data.text:
Went on a Sunday for breakfast after church.... It was extremely busy... But still had GREAT service and really good food.sat out on the covered patio it was nice to sit outside. 
Oh ya... The coffee was good too!

data.title: Breakfast Favorite
data.text:
We come here at least 2-3 times a month for breakfast.  I usually get the "Valley" or and menudo on the weekends cause its pretty good.  They are a nice cafe, enjoy the coffee and the people.  Many many regulars come here lol I think we are now ones also.  We've tried all the breakfast specials, yes yes yes to them all.  TASTY just the feel of a diner and cafe spot. 
Oh prices CANNOT be beat!

data.title: My Kinda Place...!!!
data.text: Been going there for years.... The Food is Awesome, large portions, good prices... Excellent service by friendly peoplw...

data.title: Bland
data.text: I live not too far from this location so I tried to like this place but the food was bland, and the service was slow.

data.title: great food
data.text: always good food. the daily specials  always great choices and great deals . servers on on top of things.

data.title: home style food
data.text: great place to get a home style meal without the crouds or high prices, lots to choose from on the menu

data.title: Excellent breakfast
data.text: It's a good restaurant. The food here is pretty good and really cheap here. I had a big meal of hash browns, French toast, bacon, eggs, toast and coffee. Overall the food was excellent and delicious. The customer service is good and hope they keep that up.

data.title: Great Breakfast for Low Price
data.text: On a friends recommendation my wife and I decided to have a Sunday morning Breakfast at the Peoria Café. The place was busy, but we were immediately greeted and seated within 5 minutes. The waitress (tall attractive blonde) immediately came to our table and was friendly and had water and coffee to us within moments of being seated. I ask several questions about the daily specials and then inquired about the Mexican style breakfast on the menu. This gal really knew the products and based upon her recommendations I had a bowl of Menudo soup and my wife had Huevos Rancheros. The wait on the food was less than 10 minutes and the presentation was really attractive. WoW! the food was delicious. We are natives to Arizona and have eaten Mexican Breakfast all our lives and this was really good food. Now I understand why this is such a busy restaurant. Upon completion of our meal our waitress recommend we come back on Friday night for their fish fry and I think that will be put on our To Do List. I enjoyed the meal so much that I left a 30% tip for our waitress. I highly recommend this restaurant and look forward to a return visit.

data.title: Old fashioned home cooking
data.text: great home cooking type of food. Friday is all you can eat fish fry and gets packed. Locals love it there. Nice service as well.

data.title: Family night out.
data.text: Peoria Cafe is a good place to eat, love their biscuits and gravy.  Their fish on Friday is so good.  The people there are friendly too.
